item.title: Were you aware of the Extender Setup process?
item.description:
As someone who frequently reviews training materials, I recently came across an interesting note in the Microsoft Dynamics GP Extender manual. The manual advises users to only enable the “Auto-Update SmartLists” option in a single company within Extender’s options. This recommendation stems from the system-wide nature of SmartLists contrasting with the company-specific design of Extender windows. The suggested approach is to designate a “main” company where this option is enabled, perform all Extender configurations within that company, and then export and import the necessary windows to other companies as needed...

item.title: Choose blogs that start with [%] in the Smartlist.
item.description:
Last week, I encountered a simple but frustrating issue. I needed to find all payables transactions with a document number starting with a percent sign. The client used this to flag specific invoices for further processing. I created a Payables Transaction SmartList in Microsoft Dynamics GP with the following criteria: Document Number begins with %, Vendor ID is ‘XYZ’, Document Amount is between $50 and $5,000, and Document Date is between 01/01/2023 and 01/31/2023...

item.title: Speeding up the SmartList Export to Excel process
item.description:
On his blog, Developing for Dynamics GP, Patrick Roth describes a useful, albeit undocumented and unsupported, method for speeding up SmartList exports to Excel. While this approach may lead to formatting issues, the significant performance gains likely outweigh the effort of manually reformatting in Excel. This discussion reminded me of a past client who utilized GP 7.5 with Excel 2003 to export large datasets. Due to Excel 2003’s row limit of 65,536, I created a VB application that split the exported data into multiple CSV files, each below the row limit...
